name: biomni-find-restriction-enzymes
title: Biomni: Find Restriction Enzymes
description: Identify all common restriction enzyme sites in a DNA sequence
content:
Overview

This tool identifies all common restriction enzyme recognition sites present in a DNA sequence. It searches through a comprehensive database of commercially available restriction enzymes and reports which ones have recognition sites in the input sequence. The tool helps researchers quickly identify suitable enzymes for cloning without manually checking each enzyme individually.

Input Parameters

  • sequence: DNA sequence to analyze (string)
  • --circular: Optional flag indicating sequence is circular (default: linear)

Biological Use Case

Facilitates enzyme selection for molecular cloning:

  • Identify available enzymes for linearizing vectors
  • Find unique cutters for directional cloning
  • Discover enzymes that cut once for insert removal
  • Screen for enzymes absent in coding sequences (for cloning purposes)
  • Identify enzymes for restriction mapping experiments
  • Find compatible enzyme pairs for double digests

Output

Returns a parameters (common_enzymes.json) listing all restriction enzymes that recognize sites in the sequence, including their cut positions and recognition sequences.

Category

molecular_biology
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python3 prod_apps/biomni/molecular_biology/find_restriction_enzymes.py "${sequence}" ${circular} -o "${outputDir}"
